Detailed Description

iStuff Mobile proxy program to communicate with the Event Heap

This is iStuff Mobile proxy Class which communicates with the Event Heap. The two main functionalities of this class are:

  1. Receive events of type iStuffMobile from the Event Heap and send appropriate commands to the iStuffMobile mobile phone application.
  2. Receive Key Press events from the iStuffMobile mobile phone application and post corresponding key events on the Event Heap.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

iStuffMobileProxy.iStuffMobileProxy (  String  ip,
String  proxyID,
String  cmprt
) 
 

iStuffMobile class constructor

The constructor take Event Heap ip address, the current proxy Id and a COM port name as an input.

Parameters:
ip as a String. Specifies the IP address of the Event Heap
proxyID as a String. Specifies the proxy ID to be used while posting Events and to be checked while receiving events.
cmprt as a String. Specifies the COM Port name.

Member Function Documentation

void iStuffMobileProxy.Destroy (   ) 
 

Disconnects the proxy.

This method is called when Ctrl + C is hit on the keyboard. It sends a Disconnect command to the iStuffMobile mobile phone application, closes I/O streams and exits the Proxy.

void iStuffMobileProxy.initSerial (   )  throws Exception [private]
 

Initializes the serial ports.

This method initializes the input and output stream member variables. It throws an exception if the COM port identifier is not found.

void iStuffMobileProxy.read (  InputStream  in,
byte[]  buffer,
int  off,
int  len
)  throws IOException
 

Reads data from input stream.

This method reads data from the given input stream(in) into the provided buffer(buffer) starting from an offset index(off). Number of bytes to be read are specified by length(len).

Parameters:
[in] in as an InputStream object. Data is read from this input stream.
[out] buffer as a Byte array. The read data is copied to this buffer as bytes.
[in] off as an Integer. Specifies the offset index from which writing into the buffer should start.
[in] len as an Integer. Specifies the number of bytes to be read from the given input stream.

boolean iStuffMobileProxy.returnEvent (  Event[]  retEvents  ) 
 

Callback Method from the Event Heap.

This method is called with the event being returned and matching templates, if appropriate, whenever a new event in a notification stream arrives.

Parameters:
retEvents as an Event array. The first element of the array is the matching event. Subsequent events in the array are the template events used for the match.
Returns:
The function should return true if it wants to continue recieving callbacks, and false if it is done and doesn't want to recieve any more callbacks.
